unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**
normalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – The rollout of Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) infrastructure is accelerating across India, promising enhanced internet speeds and connectivity for millions. Telecom giant, Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL), recently announced significant progress in its FTTH expansion plans, particularly in tier-2 and tier-3 cities like Patna and Lucknow.
normalised: New Delhi – The rollout of Fiber-to-Home (F T T H) infrastructure is accelerating across India, promising enhanced internet speeds and connectivity for millions. Telecom giant, Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (B S N L), recently announced significant progress in its F T T H expansion plans, particularly in tier-two and tier-three cities like Patna and Lucknow.

unnormalised: Dr. Rajesh Kumar, Director of Technology at BSNL, stated that the company aims to connect over 5 million homes by the end of 2024, investing Rs. 20,000 crore in the project. The initiative focuses on providing seamless access to online education, healthcare, and entertainment for families residing in even the most remote areas.
normalised: Doctor Rajesh Kumar, Director of Technology at B S N L, stated that the company aims to connect over five million homes by the end of two thousand and twenty four, investing rupees twenty thousand crore in the project. The initiative focuses on providing seamless access to online education, healthcare, and entertainment for families residing in even the most remote areas.

unnormalised: Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are also aggressively expanding their FTTH networks, creating a competitive landscape. Industry analysts predict that FTTH penetration will reach 60% of Indian households within the next 5 years, driving economic growth and digital inclusion. This expansion will enable services like smart home solutions in sprawling housing complexes, requiring robust connectivity for devices within each 2,000 sq ft apartment. Local cable operators are also partnering to leverage the demand.
normalised: Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are also aggressively expanding their F T T H networks, creating a competitive landscape. Industry analysts predict that F T T H penetration will reach sixty percent of Indian households within the next five years, driving economic growth and digital inclusion. This expansion will enable services like smart home solutions in sprawling housing complexes, requiring robust connectivity for devices within each two thousand square feet apartment. Local cable operators are also partnering to leverage the demand.
